<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="UTF-8">
  <title>Proposed Effects of EU Omnibus Package</title>
  <style>
    body {
      font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
      padding: 2em;
      background-color: #f9f9f9;
    }
    .table {
      width: 100%;
      max-width: 900px;
      margin: 0 auto;
      border-collapse: collapse;
      background-color: white;
      box-shadow: 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);
    }
    .table th, .table td {
      border: 1px solid #ccc;
      padding: 1em;
      vertical-align: top;
      text-align: left;
    }
    .table th {
      background-color: #002060;
      color: white;
      font-size: 1.1em;
    }
    .table td.title {
      background-color: #d9e1f2;
      font-weight: bold;
      width: 25%;
    }
    .table td.content {
      background-color: #f2f2f2;
    }
    ul {
      margin: 0;
      padding-left: 1.2em;
    }
  </style>
</head>
<body>
  <table class="table">
    <thead>
      <tr>
        <th colspan="2">Proposed Effects of EU Omnibus Package on Standards Set by the CSDDD (2024/1760)</th>
      </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
      <tr>
        <td class="title">Harmonization</td>
        <td class="content">
          <ul>
            <li>Expanded harmonization of due diligence rules across the EU, especially for impact identification, remediation, and complaints mechanisms.</li>
            <li>Member States can still go beyond in areas like labor law, where EU competence is limited.</li>
          </ul>
        </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td class="title">Stakeholder Definition</td>
        <td class="content">
          <ul>
            <li>Stakeholders now limited to:</li>
            <li>Workers and their representatives</li>
            <li>Individuals and communities directly affected by a company or its direct business partners.</li>
          </ul>
        </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td class="title">Focus on Direct Business Partners</td>
        <td class="content">
          <ul>
            <li>Due diligence is now limited to direct business partners, unless credible evidence suggests harm deeper in the value chain.</li>
            <li>Indirect partners only investigated under specific conditions (complaints, known past harm, media reports, etc.).</li>
          </ul>
        </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td class="title">Mandatory Termination of Relationships</td>
        <td class="content">
          <ul>
            <li>Termination is no longer mandatory even when there is evidence of serious harm.</li>
            <li>Companies may instead suspend the relationship and attempt remediation.</li>
          </ul>
        </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td class="title">Less Frequent Monitoring</td>
        <td class="content">
          <ul>
            <li>Companies now required to assess due diligence effectiveness every five years (instead of every year), unless urgent issues arise.</li>
          </ul>
        </td>
      </tr>
    </tbody>
  </table>
</body>
</html>
